required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MEDI7352 in Painful Osteoarthritis of the Knee
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single- and Multiple-Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of MEDI7352 in Subjects With Painful Osteoarthritis of the Knee.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, drug levels and effects on the body of MEDI7352, in subjects with painful osteoarthritis of the knee.

detailed_description.textblock: An interleaved SAD/MAD Study to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of MEDI7352 in subjects with painful osteoarthritis of the knee.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability of MEDI7352
primary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose

primary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, urinalysis)

primary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose
primary_outcome.description: 12 Lead electrocardiogram (including QTc, QRS, PR intervals and ventricular rate)

primary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs (systolic and diastolic BP), heart rate

secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma drug concentration versus time curves from zero to infinity and to last observation (AUC 0-inf; AUC 0-t).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Tmax) of MEDI7352
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time to maximum observed plasma drug concentration (Tmax).

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal plasma elimination half-life (t1/2) of MEDI7352
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose
All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose

secondary_outcome.measure: The presence of anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) to MEDI7352
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of anti-drug antibodies (a measure of the body's immune response to the drug).

secondary_outcome.description: Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) pain subscale, stiffness subscale and function subscale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits from screening up to 56 days post single dose/84 days post multiple dose

arm_group.description: Up to 10 cohorts of subjects are planned to be dosed by IV infusion, with single and multiple ascending doses.
Up to 10 cohorts of subjects are planned to be dosed by IV infusion, with single and multiple ascending doses.
2 cohorts of subjects are planned to be dosed by subcutaneous injection, one single ascending dose cohort and one multiple ascending dose cohort
2 cohorts of subjects are planned to be dosed by subcutaneous injection, one single ascending dose cohort and one multiple ascending dose cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects with painful osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee. Female subjects must be postmenopausal or surgically sterile.
- Body weight between 50kg and 145kg
- Willing and able to comply with the requirements of the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current treatment with another biologic therapeutic agent
- Current of historical diagnosis of RA
- Current diagnosis of an immunological condition that is associated with another form of arthritis in addition to OA, including traumatic arthritis or a seronegative spondyloarthropathy
- At risk of destructive arthropathy, including Rapidly Progressive Osteoarthritis (RPOA), osteonecrosis, spontaneous osteonecrosis of the knee, subchondral insufficiency fractures, hip dislocation and pathological fracture
- Presence of clinically significant neuropathy or other clinically significant disorder involving abnormal peripheral sensation.
- Current serious or unstable clinically important illness.

overall_official.last_name: David Bell, MB BCh BAO MRCGP FFPM
